definition: to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: When he fulminated against fashionable society he always spoke of its "trend";
sentences.chinese: 當他怒斥上流社會的痼疾時，總是說起它的“潮流”。

sentences.english: Du aunt anger hit Zhi ANN, and responsible to our.
sentences.chinese: 杜姨娘怒打芷安，並怒斥丁香負責任。

sentences.english: He paced up and down, fulminating against his son.
sentences.chinese: 他踱來踱去，怒斥他的兒子。

sentences.english: The majority fails to understand what donor dollars can buy, fumed Mr Breyer.
sentences.chinese: 佈雷耶怒斥多數派沒能理解捐贈方的手中的金權。

sentences.english: Many people are fulminating against luxury and idleness.
sentences.chinese: 人們怒斥奢侈與懶惰行爲。

definition: to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
